eligibilityCriteria: Uninsured patients or those concerned about their ability to pay for Natera genetic testing
medicareCoverage: Signatera covered for Stage II-IV colorectal cancer, muscle invasive bladder cancer, Stage II-IV breast cancer, Stage I-III NSCLC, Stage II-IV ovarian/fallopian tube/peritoneal cancer, and monitoring response to immune-checkpoint inhibitor therapy. Altera covered for recurrent, relapsed, refractory, metastatic, or advanced stages III or IV solid tumors. Empower covered for genetic cancer risk assessment.
applicationProcess: Contact by phone at 650-489-9050 option 2 or email oncologybilling@natera.com
appealsSupport: Will work with patients so that cost is not a barrier for testing
selfPayPrice: Affordable cash pay rate available for those who do not wish to use insurance
summaryForPatients: Natera offers financial assistance programs to ensure cost is not a barrier to testing, with affordable cash pay rates and support for uninsured patients. They work with most insurance plans and provide Medicare coverage for multiple cancer types. Contact 650-489-9050 option 2 for billing support and financial assistance.

maxOutOfPocket: $100 maximum for qualifying patients, $0 for State Medicaid recipients
eligibilityCriteria: Need-based financial assistance for eligible patients, State Medicaid recipients automatically qualify for $0 cost
medicaidCoverage: State Medicaid recipients pay $0 out-of-pocket and don't need to apply. Managed Medicaid patients need to apply for financial assistance to see if they qualify
medicareCoverage: Qualifying Original Medicare beneficiaries have no out-of-pocket costs for Foundation Medicine NGS testing. More than 80 health plans cover Foundation Medicine tests including Original Medicare and Medicare Advantage
applicationProcess: Complete online form or PDF application, or contact Client Services team
paymentPlans: Payment plans may be available for patients who don't qualify for financial assistance
priorAuthHelp: Yes, they help obtain prior authorizations when required
appealsSupport: Yes, they bill health plans and appeal denials with patient consent
summaryForPatients: Foundation Medicine offers financial assistance for eligible patients who qualify based on need, with a maximum out-of-pocket cost of $100. They also provide comprehensive support through their FoundationAccess program including benefits investigation, prior authorization help, and insurance appeals. State Medicaid recipients pay nothing out-of-pocket.

medicareCoverage: We bill insurance or Medicare for most of this testing
appealsSupport: If you receive a denial letter, an explanation of benefits, or a bill, we are here to help
summaryForPatients: NeoGenomics offers financial assistance options and helps patients with insurance denials or billing issues. They have broad insurance networks to provide cost-effective services and patient support is available Monday-Friday 8am-6pm ET at 866.776.5907.

Caris offers financial assistance programs for patients that provide added financial flexibility for molecular testing. Most insurance plans cover Caris molecular testing, and they bill insurance companies directly as an independent service provider. Patients typically receive bills only after insurance processing is complete, usually 60-90 days after testing.
